page.title: 05BOHUNT MANOR
page.content: Bohunt Manor was built in 1934 - 1936 and it was altered in 1974. The Barns are dated to 1979. It has got a lake which is a natural lake. The dam is about 100 years old. It keeps animals like Beef cattle, ducks and geese. It is open to the public and and the pubilc pay 10p for children and 50p for adults. This money goes towards world wildlife funds. Lady Holman owns it and, she has given it to the wildlife. The peaceful park is open to the public but the house isn't. It is lovely to sit down and spot a rabbit or squirrel running up a tree. The Manor takes up 132 acres of land and it takes 4 gareners to look after it, Bohunt school was named after the manor as the school was built on the Bohunt manors land.
